casebody.data:
687 A.2d 660 In the Matter of the Application of Mark Richard BRONSTON for Admission to the Bar of Maryland. Misc. No. 4,

Sept. Term, 1996.

Court of Appeals of Maryland. Jan. 15, 1997. William F. Abell, Jr., Frederick, for Petitioner. No argument on behalf of Respondent.

Argued before MURPHY,* C.J., and ELDRIDGE, RODOWSKY, CHASANOW, KARWACKI, BELL, and RAKER, JJ.

Reargued before BELL, C.J., and ELDRIDGE, RODOWSKY, CHASANOW, KARWACKI, RAKER, and WILNER, JJ.

Murphy, C.J., retired prior to reargument.

ORDER

The Court having considered the adverse recommendations of the Character Committee for the Seventh Judicial Circuit of Maryland and the State Board of Law Examiners, the memorandum of the applicant in support of his application for admission, the supplemental report of the Board dated October 28, 1996 and having carefully considered the oral arguments of counsel for the applicant, it is the 15th day of January, 1997.

ORDERED, by the Court of Appeals of Maryland, that the application for admission to the Bar of the State of Maryland filed by MARK RICHARD BRONSTON be, and it is hereby, denied.
